means: 预订( book的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: In her spare time she read books on cooking.
sentence.Network_cn: 业余时间里她看一些烹饪方面的书籍。

sentence.Network_en: For her, books were as necessary to life as bread.
sentence.Network_cn: 对她来说，书就像面包一样，是生活必需品。

sentence.Network_en: His exercise books were full of well deserved red ticks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的练习本上尽是些红钩钩，都是他应得的。

entry.def: A book is a number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. Books contain information, stories, or poetry, for example.

example.ex: His eighth book came out earlier this year and was an instant best-seller...
example.tran: 他的第8本书在今年早些时候面世，迅速成为了畅销书。

example.ex: 'Robinson Crusoe' is one of the most famous books in the world.
example.tran: 《鲁宾逊漂流记》是一本世界名著。

entry.tran: 一册（邮票）；一纸板（火柴）；一本（票券）
entry.def: A book of something such as stamps, matches, or tickets is a small number of them fastened together between thin cardboard covers.

example.ex: Can I have a book of first class stamps please?
example.tran: 请给我一板第一类邮件的邮票好吗？

entry.def: When you book something such as a hotel room or a ticket, you arrange to have it or use it at a particular time.

example.ex: British officials have booked hotel rooms for the women and children...
example.tran: 英国官员已为妇女和儿童预订了宾馆房间。

example.ex: Laurie revealed she had booked herself a flight home last night.
example.tran: 劳丽透露她昨晚已为自己预订了返家的机票。

entry.tran: （公司或组织机构的）账册，账簿，名册
entry.def: A company's  or organization's books are its records of money that has been spent and earned or of the names of people who belong to it.

example.ex: For the most part he left the books to his managers and accountants...
example.tran: 他通常都把账册交给经理和会计们处理。

example.ex: Around 12 per cent of the people on our books are in the computing industry.
example.tran: 我们的名册中有大约12%的人供职于计算机行业。

entry.tran: （足球裁判）记名警告（严重犯规的球员）
entry.def: When a referee books a football player who has seriously broken the rules of the game, he or she officially writes down the player's name.

example.ex: League referee Keith Cooper booked him in the first half for a tussle with the goalie.
example.tran: 联赛裁判基思·库珀在上半场因他与守门员抢球犯规而对他记名警告。

entry.def: When a police officer books someone, he or she officially records their name and the offence that they may be charged with.

example.ex: They took him to the station and booked him for assault with a deadly weapon.
example.tran: 他们把他带到警察局，把他用致命武器袭击他人的罪行记录在案。

entry.def: In a very long written work such as the Bible, a book is one of the sections into which it is divided.
If you are in someone's bad books, they are annoyed with you. If you are in their good books, they are pleased with you.

example.ex: Sir John was definitely in the Treasury's bad books for incorrect thinking on economic prospects...
example.tran: 约翰爵士肯定不受财政部的待见，因为他对经济前景的预测并不准确。

example.ex: Right from my very first day I seemed to be in everyone's good books.
example.tran: 自打第一天起，我好像就和每个人都很合得来。

entry.def: If you bring someone to book, you punish them for an offence or make them explain their behaviour officially.

example.ex: Police should be asked to investigate so that the guilty can be brought to book soon.
example.tran: 应该要求警方介入调查，以将罪犯早日绳之以法。

entry.tran: 完全不了解的人；一无所知的事物；谜
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a closed book, you mean that you do not know anything about them.

example.ex: Frank Spriggs was a very able man but something of a closed book...
example.tran: 弗兰克·斯普里格斯是一个很有才干的人，但是有些让人捉摸不透。

example.ex: Economics was a closed book to him.

entry.tran: （旅馆、餐馆、剧院或交通工具）被预订一空，满座，客满
entry.def: If a hotel, restaurant, theatre, or transport service is fully booked, or booked solid, it is booked up.

example.ex: The car ferries from the mainland are often fully booked by February.
example.tran: 从大陆出发的汽车轮渡常常在2月前就被预订一空。

entry.def: In my book means 'in my opinion' or 'according to my beliefs'.

example.ex: The greatest manager there has ever been, or ever will be in my book, is retiring.
example.tran: 这位迄今为止最杰出的，在我看来，也是后人无法超越的经理，就要退休了。

entry.def: If someone in authority throws the book at someone who has committed an offence, they give the offender the greatest punishment that they are allowed to.

auth_sentence.content: The effect on these firms books would be devastating.
auth_sentence.res_content: The effect on these firms books would be devastating.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The effect on these firms books would be devastating.

auth_sentence.content: The Limbic System is in all the text books.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Limbic System is in all the text books.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Limbic System is in all the text books.

auth_sentence.content: Not all books lend themselves to binding, though.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not all books lend themselves to binding, though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not all books lend themselves to binding, though.
